intro: Govenia bella, commonly known as the fairy bellflower, is a delicate flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes bellflowers and other similar species. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, often with a contrasting purple or violet throat. It thrives in moist, woodland environments and prefers partial to full shade. Govenia bella is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in shaded forest understories.
